name: Shoreline Access & FAQ's.txt - Shoreline Access
description: This section explains the process of accessing the Shoreline application, which is integrated with Google's Identity Provider (IDP). There are two Google groups, 'Shoreline-Stage' and 'Shoreline-Prod', that grant access to the staging and production environments of the Shoreline app, respectively. To gain access, users need to request the IT team (@techit) in the #tech_it channel to add them to the appropriate group. Once added, users can access the Shoreline app through Google Apps, and the app will redirect them to the corresponding staging or production URL. Direct access to the endpoints is not recommended.
use_cases: Accessing the Shoreline application in the staging environment for testing and development purposes
Accessing the Shoreline application in the production environment for live usage
Requesting access to the Shoreline application through the IT team
Accessing Shoreline notebooks with read and run permissions based on group membership

name: Shoreline Access & FAQ's.txt - Access Control
description: This section explains how to control access and permissions for users in the Shoreline platform. It covers limiting the number of resources, metrics, actions, and Linux commands that users can view or execute. It also discusses granting 'Configure' and 'Administer' roles to users. The section differentiates between access levels for Stage and Production environments, and provides instructions on how to request temporary privileged access for specific use cases.
use_cases: Controlling access for Stage and Production environments
Requesting temporary privileged access for Central Dashboard, Security, or other use cases
Limiting the number of resources, metrics, actions, and Linux commands accessible to users

name: Shoreline Access & FAQ's.txt - Notebooks restriction
description: This section explains a feature in Shoreline that allows users to create notebooks and restrict access to specific team members. Users can grant 'run access' to selected team members by adding them to the 'Allowed users' list for a particular notebook. It also provides instructions on how to seek help for notebook implementation, report issues with Shoreline backend or agents, and onboard notebooks to the production environment after testing in a staging environment. Additionally, it mentions the availability of predefined Kubernetes cluster resources for running commands.
use_cases: Restricting access to notebooks for specific team members
Reporting issues with Shoreline backend or agents
Onboarding notebooks to production after testing in staging
capabilities: Report issues with Shoreline backend or agents

name: Shoreline Access & FAQ's.txt - Stage account K8s cluster
description: This section provides instructions on how to access and manage a Kubernetes (K8s) cluster for a staging environment, specifically the 'stage_white_eks' cluster. It includes screenshots that guide the user through the process of executing commands and viewing the output related to the staging cluster.
use_cases: Managing a Kubernetes cluster for a staging environment
Accessing and executing commands on the 'stage_white_eks' cluster
Viewing the output of executed commands related to the staging cluster

name: Shoreline Access & FAQ's.txt - Production K8s clusters resources
description: This section provides information about Kubernetes (K8s) clusters used in production environments at Razorpay, as well as details on integrating with Shoreline, a tool for executing notebooks and queries. It explains how to link Shoreline notebooks with Alertmanager alerts, execute Prometheus and Coralogix queries within Shoreline, and troubleshoot common issues related to query execution and data retrieval.
use_cases: Monitoring and managing production K8s clusters
Executing Prometheus queries within Shoreline notebooks
Querying Coralogix logs from Shoreline notebooks
Automating notebook execution based on Alertmanager alerts
capabilities: List of production K8s cluster resources
Linking Shoreline notebooks with Alertmanager alerts
Troubleshooting Prometheus and Coralogix query issues
Retrieving Coralogix tokens from Kubernetes secrets
